quoteFirst: In the fort, the light wooden buildings were in flames at an early hour; then the walls began to crumble before the balls which came from every quarter, front, flank, and rear; and as the guns were disabled successively, the return became feeble, until few were in condition to be fired, the central redoubt alone discharging single guns at long intervals. The Russian commander, however, made no sign of surrender; but the admirals, seeing that his fire had ceased, and further defence was unavailing, hoisted the white flag at
quoteLast: , upon which the works were given up on honorable terms."
title:
Elements of Military Art and Science
Or, Course Of Instruction In Strategy, Fortification, Tactics Of Battles, &C.; Embracing The Duties Of Staff, Infantry, Cavalry, Artillery, And Engineers; Adapted To The Use Of Volunteers And Militia; Third Edition; With Critical Notes On The Mexican And Crimean Wars.
author: Halleck, H. W. (Henry Wager), 1815-1872

quoteTime: five and twenty minutes to two
quoteLast: , and, knowing that there was a public telephone in the station, he crossed the road and entered the box.  After a brief delay he succeeded in getting Mark's number.
title: The Red Lodge: A Mystery of Campden Hill
author: Bridges, Victor, 1878-1972

quoteFirst: He was a quiet, dry little Plymouth lawyer, and very civilly answered all my questions about the last days of my old friend. At last I asked him to tell me as near as he could the time of his death; and he put on his spectacles, and got his diary, and turned over the leaves. I was quite nervous till he looked up and said, ‘
quoteLast: , sir, A.M., on the morning of October 21st; or it might be a few minutes later.’
title:
True Manliness
From the Writings of Thomas Hughes
author: Hughes, Thomas, 1822-1896; Lowell, James Russell, 1819-1891 [Author of introduction, etc.]; Brown, E. E. (Emma Elizabeth), 1847- [Compiler]

quoteFirst: We were now working to wind’ard to the entrance of the Pearl Islands. At
quoteLast: we started the motor, and at 4.50 p.m. brought up for the night in 13 fms. between Monge and Puercos islets, which lie off the east coast of the large Isla del Rey. We have done 60 miles to-day.
title: The mystery of Easter island: the story of an expedition
author: Routledge, Katherine, 1866-1935

title: Paul Clifford — Volume 07

quoteFirst: Adda, by the explosion of the main magazine, at
quoteLast: The "Inflexible" weighed soon after 8 A.M. and engaged Ras-el-Tin, afterwards attacking Forts Pharos and Adda. The "Condor," followed by the "Beacon," "Bittern" and "Decoy," engaged Fort Marabout soon after 8 A.M. till 11 A.M., when the gunboats were recalled.
title:
Encyclopaedia Britannica, 11th Edition, "Edwardes, Sir Herbert Benjamin" to "Ehrenbreitstein"

quoteFirst: But it is even more important to keep certain fundamentals in mind. To read the tape is not to have your fortune told. The tape does not tell you how much you will surely be worth next Thursday at
quoteLast: The object of reading the tape is to ascertain, first, how and, next, when to trade--that is, whether it is wiser to buy than to sell. It works exactly the same for stocks as for cotton or wheat or corn or oats.
title: Reminiscences of a Stock Operator
author: Lefevre, Edwin, 1871-1943
